title.narrative: KNOWLEDGE ON NEONATAL AND MATERNAL CARE

description.narrative: At least 80% of mothers Including pregnant women in selected communities in targeted localities have comprehensive knowledge and capacity to seek appropriate neonatal, child, and maternal health care, including HIV/AIDS (including nationwide interventions).

sector.narrative: Facility based maternal and newborn care (including emergency obstetric and newborn care, quality improvement)

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: At least 80% of mothers Including pregnant women in selected communities in targeted localities have comprehensive knowledge and capacity to seek appropriate neonatal, child, and maternal health care, including HIV/AIDS (including nationwide interventions).

description.narrative: At least 85% of mothers including pregnant women acquired comprehensive knowledge on key family practices and appropriate care seeking behaviors especially in the hard to reach areas of Jebel Mara, White Nile and Darfur states. | Status:Met | As-of Date:16/01/2018

title.narrative: Mothers and caregivers with knowledge of at least 5 of the UNICEF essential family practices
